definition:
\begin{definition}
For a local operator $\mathcal{O}(x)$ the generalized form factors \cite{KW}
are defined as
\[
\,\mathcal{O}_{\alpha_{1}\dots\alpha_{n}}\left(  \theta_{1},\dots,\theta
_{n}\right)  =\langle\,0\,|\,\mathcal{O}(0)\,|\,p_{1},\dots,p_{n}%
\,\rangle_{\alpha_{1}\dots\alpha_{n}}^{in}%
\]
for $\theta_{1}>\dots>\theta_{n}$. For other orders of the rapidities they are
defined by analytic continuation. The index $\alpha_{i}$\thinspace denotes the
type of the particle with momentum $p_{i}$. We also use the short notations
$\mathcal{O}_{\underline{\alpha}}(\underline{\theta})$ or $\mathcal{O}_{1\dots
n}(\underline{\theta})$.
\
